intro: Neomanniophyton zenkeri f. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved neomanniophyton, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and distinctive floral structures. Native to specific regions in Africa, this plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for taxonomical and ecological studies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
